title: Two explosions rock Somalia's capital, killing at least 30
description: Two car bombs exploded Saturday in Mogadishu at a busy junction near key government offices. The attack occurred on a day when government other officials were meeting to discuss expanded efforts to combat violent extremism.

title: Dozens suffer cardiac arrests at Halloween celebrations in South Korea
description: Officials dozens of people have been injured from crushing because of a large crowd in the Itaewon district of Seoul.

title: Is Rishi Sunak well-suited for the job? Does anyone care?
description: After becoming the youngest prime minister in recent British history, will Rishi Sunak, a former Hindu investment banker, impress on the job?

title: Attack on Pelosi's husband deepens fears over safety of US politicians
description: In 2021, the Capitol Police identified 9,600 threats against lawmakers, primarily ethnic minority women and members of the January 6 committee looking into the assault on the Capitol.

title: Northern Ireland heading for another election only six months after its last one
description: The Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), Northern Ireland's main unionist party, has refused to take a seat in the Assembly to restore the devolved government.

title: United States releases oldest prisoner from Guantanamo, returns to Pakistan
description: US forces repatriated Saifullah Paracha after the 75-year-old was held for 20 years without charge.

title: Russia says ships attacked in Sevastopol were part of UN grain deal
description: Russian-installed authorities placed blame on Ukraine and the UK for the drone attack on Sevastopol, which they say they repelled after shooting down multiple drones.

title: Elon Musk is not the answer to Twitter's problems
description: The takeover of the social media giant by a billionaire directly involved in political action is a first, and the risk of a conflict of interest is huge.

title: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva: 'Another Brazil is possible'
description: After four years of a regime that exacerbated crises and isolated the country, the former Brazilian president, who is running for a new term, presents a policy that intends to respond to the climate emergency and work for a multipolar world.

title: Elon Musk begins to leave his mark on Twitter
description: Twitter's newly minted owner began his new role by announcing a content moderation council.

title: Pelosi attack suspect had posted about QAnon
description: The attack on House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband Paul Pelosi is the latest in a series of violent acts in the US ahead of midterm elections.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro, Lula face off in last debate before vote
description: The two candidates clashed once again in their final debate together, their last chance to reach millions of Brazilians before Sunday's vote.

title: Weaponizing tragic news stories: A long-standing political tradition in France
description: Long before the far right co-opted the murder of 12-year-old Lola in Paris on October 14, many highly publicized events triggered the very self-serving interest of the political establishment.

title: Intruder targeting US politician Nancy Pelosi attacks her husband with hammer
description: Local media  reported that the intruder – who has been apprehended – shouted 'Where's Nancy?' during the brutal assault.

title: In Paris, Laurent Grasso casts his spells at the Collège des Bernadins
description: In the nave of what is now a cultural center in Paris, the artist combines every kind of know-how to create inconceivable and yet plausible images.

title: Belgium's unity remains undermined by the language barrier
description: French-speaking Minister of Education Caroline Désir suggested making Dutch classes compulsory in Wallonia. This reform will be difficult to implement because of the critical shortage of skilled teachers and the political context.

title: Energy prices: 'Part of the European industry fears that it no longer has much of a future'
description: Following the boss of German chemical company BASF, who is ostensibly looking to China, many players fear a permanent drop in competition owing to the energy crisis, says Philippe Escande, economic editor at 'Le Monde.'

title: France undergoes an intense and unprecedented heat wave in late October
description: October 2022 is set to be the hottest month ever recorded, following a year of extreme temperatures likely to break the country's record.

title: The National Museum of Baghdad and the journey of the Gilgamesh Dream Tablet
description: The fate of this thousand-year-old clay tablet – stolen in 1991, seized by American authorities in 2019 and returned to the museum last year – is typical of the situation for thousands of works of art looted in Iraq since the Gulf War.

title: In Ukraine, the boss of a leading aviation company is arrested for collaborating with Russia
description: Viacheslav Bogouslaev is the president and main shareholder of Motor Sitch factory, the number one manufacturer in the Ukrainian defense industry. He is accused of having continued to supply Moscow.
